Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing McCoy, Macintosh, and Truview Laryngoscopes for Bougie-Aided Nasotracheal Intubation

Trial_Design.evidence: A prospective randomised controlled trial was conducted at the All India Institute of Medical Sciences, Bhubaneswar.

Participants.evidence: Forty-five ASA I-II adult patients, aged 18-60, requiring NTI for elective oral surgery, were enrolled.

Intervention.evidence: Patients were randomly assigned to one of three laryngoscope groups (McCoy, Macintosh, Truview).

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the performance of McCoy, Macintosh, and Truview laryngoscopes during bougie-aided nasotracheal intubation.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was intubation time, measured from endotracheal tube insertion to capnograph visualization.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: using a computer-generated sequence with allocation concealment via sequentially numbered, opaque, sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to the patient, data collector, and analyst.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Fifteen patients were randomised to each group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Intubation times were 86.87 ± 15.92 s (McCoy), 82.87 ± 16.46 s (Macintosh), and 79.93 ± 14.53 s (Truview), with Truview being the shortest.

Harms.evidence: No significant adverse events were reported.
